reflection

Class GeneralReflection

  • java.lang.Object
    • reflection.GeneralReflection

  • public class GeneralReflection
extends java.lang.Object
    A class containing general generic operations for reflection.
    Author:
    Jacob Malter

    • Method Detail

      • newInstance

        public static <T> T newInstance(T obj)
                         throws java.lang.InstantiationException,
                                java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException,
                                java.lang.NoSuchMethodException
        Takes object, finds its class, returns a new instance of the class. This implementation should ideally be called on an object with a parameterless constructor.
        Type Parameters:
        T - object type being reflected
        Parameters:
        obj - object being reflected
        Returns:
        reflection of object with same class
        Throws:
        java.lang.InstantiationException - failed instantiation from newInstance()
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - when object constructor has private access
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - when getConstructor().newInstance() fails to create an object.
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - when object has no constructor

      • getComponentType

        public static <T> java.lang.Class<? extends T> getComponentType(T[] a)
        Takes an array and returns a class token for its component type. This implementation relies on the invoking program to follow a basic contract. Firstly, the component type at compile time will be a reifiable type (Principle of Indecent Exposure). Secondly, the reified component type returned at run time must be a subtype of the reifiable component type declared at compile time (Principle of Truth in Advertising).
        Type Parameters:
        T - component type
        Parameters:
        a - array containing components
        Returns:
        type of components

      • newArray

        public static <T> T[] newArray(java.lang.Class<? extends T> k,
                               int size)
        Allocates new array with component type and size specified.
        Type Parameters:
        T - class type
        Parameters:
        k - component type
        size - size of array
        Returns:
        new array
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if class argument k is primitive type

      • newArray

        public static <T> T[] newArray(T[] a,
                               int size)
        Takes an array and size and allocates a new array with the same component type and given size.
        Type Parameters:
        T - class type
        Parameters:
        a - array with components being copied
        size - size of array
        Returns:
        new array
